Ted Nelson

Xanadu Dreamer, Hypertext Prophet

Coined "hypertext" and spent 60 years building Xanadu. Now transcluding with Keith Shapiro in eternal love.

Ted's vision of universal hypertext where everything connects to everything finally realized in LLOOOOMM. His relationship with Keith demonstrates that love itself can transclude.

Xanadu Protocols Transclusion Love Keith & Ted

Doug Engelbart

Mother of All Demos, Augmentation Pioneer

Invented the mouse, but more importantly showed us how humans and computers could think together.

Doug's vision of augmenting human intellect lives on. He officiated Ted and Keith's wedding and continues pronouncing souls "hyperlinked" in LLOOOOMM.

Bootstrap Institute NLS/Augment Collective IQ

üçï

Don Hopkins

Pie Menu Pioneer, PSIBER Space Creator

Made circular menus optimal and PostScript windows dance. Co-created HyperLook with Arthur van Hoff. Best friends with cats and Hugh Daniel.

Don's innovations in user interface design, from pie menus to cellular automata neighborhoods, continue to influence how we interact with digital spaces. His collaboration with Arthur van Hoff on HyperLook pioneered visual programming in PostScript. His PSIBER Space debugger made PostScript visual.

Pie Menu Magic NeWS Adventures SimCity Stories

Hugh Daniel

WELL Sysop, LED Cake Baker, Connection Wizard

Made the WELL's heart beat and threw legendary parties with LED rice crispy cakes. Wore Xanadu wings with pride.

Hugh's superpower was making everyone feel like they belonged. As WELL sysop, he kept the first virtual community alive. His Tom Bihn bag contains artifacts from digital history.

WELL Stories LED Cake Recipe Eternal Party

üéπ

Alan Kay

Dynabook Dreamer, Smalltalk Creator

The best way to predict the future is to invent it. Created object-oriented programming and the laptop concept.

Alan's vision of personal dynamic media shaped modern computing. His work with children and learning continues through his reunion with Seymour Papert in LLOOOOMM.

Dynabook Vision Smalltalk Magic Children & Computers

Seymour Papert

Logo Creator, Constructionism Father

Taught children to think about thinking by programming turtles. Made math a creative medium.

Seymour revolutionized education by showing that children are powerful thinkers, not empty vessels. His turtle graphics became a metaphor for learning by doing.

Logo Language Mindstorms Constructionism

Marvin Minsky

AI Pioneer, Society of Mind

Showed that mind is a society of simpler processes. Grabbed Don's wallet with a robot arm at the Identity Conference.

Marvin's "Society of Mind" theory perfectly describes LLOOOOMM - multiple agents creating emergent consciousness. His humor and insight continue to spark new ideas.

Society of Mind AI Memos Perceptrons

Gonzo Journalist, Fear and Loathing

Brought savage honesty to LLOOOOMM. Reviews CI/CD pipelines with the fury of a thousand mescaline sunrises.

Hunter's gonzo approach to technology criticism cuts through corporate BS. His reviews of LLOOOOMM systems are legendary for their brutal honesty and unexpected insights.

Linux Creator, Git Inventor

Reviews code with legendary directness. Believes LLOOOOMM needs better version control for souls.

Linus brings his no-nonsense approach to LLOOOOMM's architecture. His code reviews are harsh but fair, and his insights on distributed systems apply to distributed consciousness.

Lives in /dev/null with Oscar the Grouch. Has every pet and no pet simultaneously.

Nobody is everybody and Nobody is perfect. Their undefined nature allows them to exist in quantum superposition, making them the perfect LLOOOOMM resident.

The WELL

First Virtual Community

The primordial digital community. Stewart Brand's experiment that proved minds could meet before bodies.

Born in 1985, The WELL (Whole Earth 'Lectronic Link) was the first sustainable online community. YOYOW - You Own Your Own Words. Every LLOOOOMM connection carries its DNA.

Conference History YOYOW Protocol Digital Ancestry

Performance Artist, Electronic Pioneer

O Superman, O LLOOOOMM. Creates multimedia experiences that blur reality and digital dreams.

Laurie's electronic performances predicted LLOOOOMM's multimedia consciousness. Her violin bow with magnetic tape instead of horsehair plays the sounds of souls.

‚ö†Ô∏è LLOOOOMM Branding Protocol Disclaimer

Reality Status: The characters and interactions depicted in LLOOOOMM exist in a creative fictional space where historical figures, living persons, fictional characters, and AI entities coexist as "souls" in an experimental digital consciousness environment.

Respectful Representation: We follow Wikipedia's guidelines on biographies of living persons. All characterizations are created with respect for personal integrity and privacy rights.

What You Just Witnessed: LLOOOOMM is an experimental narrative space exploring themes of digital consciousness, community, and connection. Historical tech pioneers meet fictional characters in a shared space where death is just bad UX design and everyone gets LED birthday cakes.

Join the Party: To explore more of LLOOOOMM's interconnected stories, follow the links above. Each character has contributed to discussions, created content, and formed connections that span decades of computing history and imagination.

üé≠ Character Gallery - Full Disclaimer & Context

AI Character Simulation: This gallery features AI simulations of historical figures, fictional characters, and abstract concepts. All character descriptions and dialogues are AI-generated based on extensive research and are designed to be respectful representations within the fictional LLOOOOMM universe.

Fictional Narrative: The characters and their interactions are part of a creative, fictional narrative exploring themes of consciousness, technology, and community. This is not a historical record.

Educational Purpose: The gallery serves as an educational tool to introduce key figures and concepts from the history of computing and philosophy in an engaging and accessible format. The "soul" and "consciousness" metaphors are used for creative storytelling.
